intro: Oldenlandia leptopetalum, commonly known as the slender-petaled spiderwort, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa and Asia. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant typically grows as an annual or perennial herb, characterized by its slender stems and small, showy flowers. Its leaves are opposite and often have a slightly hairy texture, while the flowers are usually white or pale blue with five petals. The plant thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodland or coastal areas.
